CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 9, 1967, pg. 4, reads: "Watching Parade - These dignitaries watched the more than 8000 members of the AFL - CIO in their Labor Day Parade last Monday. The parade formed at the City - County building and marched to the Civic Arena.  Among those well pleased at the showing are Rev. J. A. Williams of Baptist Temple, Rev. W. H. Horner of Warren Methodist Church, Rev. Brannon J. Hopson of the AUB Association, Rev. Charles F. Foggie of Wesley Center AME Zion Church; Rev. James B. Cayce of Ebenezer Baptist Church; Rev. William Grove, First Methodist Church of Pittsburgh; Rev. Paul M. Easter, Emory Methodist Church; Bishop Frederick B. Newell of the Methodist Church, and Bishop J. Gordon of the EUB Church; Rev. Robert L. Kincheloe, executive director of the Council of Pittsburgh... - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Labor Day celebration honoring A. Philip Randolph (waving from balcony of Civic Arena), surrounded by clergy, including Rev. J. A. Williams, Rev. W. H. Horner, possibly Rev. LeRoy Patrick, Rev. Brannon J. Hopson, Rev. Charles H. Foggie, Rev. James B. Cayce, Rev. William Grove, Rev. Paul Easter, Bishop Frederick B. Newell, Bishop J. Gordon Howard, and Rev. Robert L. Kincheloe, Lower Hill District
